differential_diagnosis: Considered diseases: Malaria and bartonellosis Reasons for consideration: Severe anaemia, jaundice, and altered neurological status are features of severe malaria. Bartonellosis is another important diagnosis to consider given the recent travel history in the highlands of Peru.
management_and_clinical_course: Initial treatment: Supportive care with oral/IV fluids and acetaminophen; no antibiotics. Clinical improvement: Clinical improvement with full recovery by day 6 Complications: No complications documented during a 3-month follow-up period.
final_diagnosis: Disease name: Bartonellosis (Oroya fever and verruga peruana) Causative agent: B. bacilliformis Confirmation method: Thick film revealed massive red blood cell infestation by pleomorphic coccobacillary structures compatible with B. bacilliformis. Evidence for alternatives ruled out: Malaria was ruled out based on negative blood films and rapid diagnostic tests.
